title: Man Utd urged to 'break the bank' to complete Kylian Mbappe transfer
text:

Former Manchester United striker Louis Saha believes the club should go all out to sign fellow Frenchman Kylian Mbappe to try to bring success back to Old Trafford.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side have struggled for goals this season following the departure of Romelu Lukaku, and have found the back of the net just three times in their last six games.

Mbappe is widely regarded as the hottest young forward in football, and the 20-year-old has been strongly linked with Real Madrid .

Speaking to Compare.Bet Saha- who scored 42 goals in 124 appearances for United- said he felt Mbappe could provide the missing ingredient for his old side.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

"If you ask me, I would break the bank for Mbappe, but now it's too late," he said.

"But, when you look at strikers, it's a dying breed. Lewandowski is a rare example of someone who is left, and I don't see many players that can easily fit up front.

"There is a need for somebody up front who is strong enough to hold the ball and to give time and space to the players like Paul Pogba and McTominay to create something in midfield to put passes together.

"You're asking a lot from young players because passing the ball around and having nice touches, it just looks too nice and it doesn't work."

So far this season Marcus Rashford is United's top scorer with four goals, with Daniel James just behind him on three.

(Image: REUTERS)

Mbappe, meanwhile, has scored two goals in five Ligue 1 matches for PSG, as well as bagging a hat-trick in the Champions League during the French team's 5-1 victory over Club Bruges on Tuesday.

PSG would no doubt demand a huge transfer fee in order for Mbappe to depart the club, with the World Cup winner's contract running until 2022.
description: One ex-United player believes Mbappe could be the answer to their problems going forward
